reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Support to the transition in Vietnam in the innovation and energy sectors
Vietnamin transition tuki innovaatio- ja energiasektoreilla

description.narrative: Transition strategy in Vietnam that aims at broader-based relations between Finland and Vietnam is implemented until the end of 2020. Large bilateral grant-based programmes financed by Finland have ended in December 2018 and the regional EEP programme will end in the spring of 2019. Finland has a strong brand as an influencial actor in the development of the innovation sector in Vietnam. through the Innovation Partnership Programme IPP II. The final evaluation of the programme has recommended that the brand visibility and functionalities created in IPP II should be maintained after the programme. In the EEP good results have been achieved and their sustainability should be supported and good cooperation has been created between the authorities and Finnish pr ivate sector actors in renewable energy that Finland wishes to support and maintain after the programme.To support the sustainability and impact of the results of the programmes it is proposed that two international experts will be financed to work in Viet nam for two years one in the science tehcnoogy and innovation sector and one in the energy sector. In addition funds will be reserved for implementation of functions in both sectors such as organizing events and facilitating delegations. In addition funds will be reserved for international and local short-term assignments.

Transition strategy in Vietnam that aims at broader-based relations between Finland and Vietnam is implemented until the end of 2020. Large bilateral grant-based programmes financed by Finland have ended in December 2018 and the regional EEP programme will end in the spring of 2019. Finland has a strong brand as an influencial actor in the development of the innovation sector in Vietnam. through the Innovation Partnership Programme IPP II. The final evaluation of the programme has recommended that the brand visibility and functionalities created in IPP II should be maintained after the programme. In the EEP good results have been achieved and their sustainability should be supported and good cooperation has been created between the authorities and Finnish pr ivate sector actors in renewable energy that Finland wishes to support and maintain after the programme.To support the sustainability and impact of the results of the programmes it is proposed that two international experts will be financed to work in Viet nam for two years one in the science tehcnoogy and innovation sector and one in the energy sector. In addition funds will be reserved for implementation of functions in both sectors such as organizing events and facilitating delegations. In addition funds will be reserved for international and local short-term assignments.

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is the main prio rity area in this activity
Improving food security, access to water and sustainability is the secondary priority area in t his activity
